actions.committee: House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs.
Reported to House from the Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs with amendments, H. Rept. 94-1654.

official_title: A bill to adjust the boundaries of certain units of the National Park System.

summary.text: (Reported to House from the Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs with amendments, H. Rept. 94-1654) =Title I: Manassas National Battlefield Park, Virginia= - Revises the boundaries of Manassas National Battlefield Park, Virginia. Authorizes the appropriation of specified sums to acquire lands within such revised boundaries. =Title II: Monocacy National Battlefield, Maryland= - Renames Monocacy National Military Park, Maryland, as Monocacy National Battlefield. Revises the boundaries of such park. Amends specified provisions relating to park administration. Authorizes the appropriation of specified sums for land acquisition and facility development. =Title III: George Washington Birthplace National Monument, Virginia= - Revises the boundaries of George Washington Birthplace National Monument, Virginia. Authorizes the appropriation of specified sums to acquire lands within such revised boundaries. =Title IV: Olympic National Park, Washington= - Revises the boundaries of Olympic National Park, Washington. Authorizes the appropriation of specified sums to acquire lands within such revised boundaries. =Title V: Pecos National Monument, New Mexico= - Authorizes the Secretary of the Interior to accept the donation of lands for addition to Pecos National Monument, New Mexico. =Title VI: Bandelier National Monument, New Mexico= - Authorizes the Secretary of the Interior to acquire specified lands for addition to Bandelier National Monument, New Mexico. Authorizes the appropriation of specified sums to purchase such lands. =Title VII: San Juan National Historical Site, Puerto Rico= - Authorizes the appropriation of up to $2,733,000 to carry out priority repairs of the historic fortifications at the San Juan National Historical Site, and to further investigate the need for repairs. =Title VIII: Edison National Historic Site, New Jersey= - Authorizes the acquisition of an additional 1.39 acres adjacent to the Edison National Historic Site. Authorizes the appropriation of specified sums for land acquisition and development. =Title IX: Morristown National Historical Park, New Jersey= - Authorizes the acquisition of an additional 135 acres for the Morristown National Historical Park. =Title X: Big Thicket National Preserve, Texas= - Redefines "residential property" for purposes of acquiring land for the Big Thicket National Preserve, specifying that the occupancy must be of a detached year-round one-family dwelling which serves as the owner's permanent place of abode at the time of acquisition. =Title XI: Cuyahoga Valley National Recreation Area, Ohio= - Creates a new map reference reflecting the authorization for acquisition of 900 additional acres for the Cuyahoga Valley National Recreation Area. Raises the acquisition ceiling to $41,000,000 to accommodate such authorization.

titles.title: A bill to adjust the boundaries of certain units of the National Park System.
